TopicTitle: Black Sun Laboratories Products *NOW FEATURING: PROJECT KEBYLON*

Articles.Content:
My ship always falls apart the moment I put it on the launchpad. I use the big boosters and heavy declouplers from Project Firelark, and attach the decouplers to normal liquid fuel tanks. When I put it on the pad the fuel tanks attached to the decouplers sever from the rest of the ship immediately, and the boosters fall away too.

This may just be an incompatibility with the 0.13.2 update, but I\'m not sure.

With the update to 0.14, project Kebylon explodes on start, no matter what you do. This is something to do with the physics rewrite, and the fact that the tower has a maxtemp of 1 (which is way below pretty much everything else). Just changing the value to something sane seems to fix this problem.

With the update to 0.14, project Kebylon explodes on start, no matter what you do. This is something to do with the physics rewrite, and the fact that the tower has a maxtemp of 1 (which is way below pretty much everything else). Just changing the value to something sane seems to fix this problem.

I think temperature has been partly implemented, so it\'d be exploding from being exposed to sunlight. Or just existing in a habitable atmosphere lol.

Yeah, I think this is due for a massive update. I think I will be redoing pretty much everything now... Especially now that plugins will allow for even more stuff (As an example, Firelark will be reborn under a new name - and I will make SURE that it will only be able to be used in itself)

Sorry for the huge delays, though. A LOT of stuff had been going on (notably my cooperation with C7 in his pack, and a large down regarding... 'some' people on these forums. But just seeing that this thread was not forgotten is enough motivation to me to keep on going). Now, the question is, should I make a new thread for it?
I tried to download project blaze, but me browser has said, 'f**k off' and said it\'s a malicious file.

Nothing much I can do, as you can see a lot of people have downloaded it and used it. Anyhow, mostly everything on here is probably broken one way or another, it\'s not been updated in ages. I\'m working on learning to write C# to bring everyone goods.
You know, you could use the launch-tower mod here to mop up space junk since 0.14 is here.
Hey, could someone post a mirror to the Kebylon tower, I think filesmelt is down.

Edited first post to add it.

While I\'m at it, I got some good news and some bad news.

The good news is, I started working on Firelark\'s 'child', Eagle. It will be a bit more modular and fit more roles. I\'ll upload a screenshot of the progress. That, and I have LOTS of ideas.

The bad news is that my main computer is broken (PSU blew) so I have to borrow a computer, and it\'s not always available, so the work will be MUCH slower. And because of that, for now mostly everything involving plugins is set aside.
I dont know what I am doing wrong but every time I use the tower the platform explodes the moment I leave the VAB to launch

I dont know what I am doing wrong but every time I use the tower the platform explodes the moment I leave the VAB to launch

The temperature resistance is set very low, and there\'s been an update since this was made that introduced ambient temperatures high enough to destroy it. Just open the .cfg and set it to something higher.
Yeah I really need to develop the habit of reading the entire thread before posting. I found that not 30 seconds after I posted. I set the max temp to 10,000.
While it\'s a very minor item in the list, the Metal Slab doesn\'t work - I can\'t get it to attach flush to a horizontal tank, it attaches at a 30 degree angle.
like to ask for a Project Blaze reup - Filesmelt seems to be on the blink
I can see lots of werid and wonderful uses for your metal slab!

While it\'s a very minor item in the list, the Metal Slab doesn\'t work - I can\'t get it to attach flush to a horizontal tank, it attaches at a 30 degree angle.

Then you are not placing it right, it requires a specific camera angle.

So, one month and three weeks, dying yes, but if you guys can add something of value to this thread, then not quite dead yet.
